pages.text: To align substances with the energies of souls, it is required to engulf them in the blue flame produced by setting $(item)soul sand$() alight. This process is known as $(thing)soul engulfing$(). Listed here are all the recipes which use it.
A blue powder that glitters with once bright light. To obtain this dust, let $(item)glowstone dust$() burn in soulfire.
The soulfire polishes the stone and tinges it blue. To obtain this rock, let $(item)deepslate$() burn in soulfire.

For more complex creations, simply using soulfire is not enough, and a $(thing)focus structure$() is needed to be built. The energy of the process is so virulent that the structure will be destroyed in the process. I shall list the structures and their uses on the following pages.

By surrounding the soulfire with soul powder, one can then engulf $(item)iron ingots$() into a far more durable form. This steel shares many properties with the cages I try to reconstruct. It has also proven a versatile material, better discussed in its own entry.
By surrounding the soulfire with compressed soul powder and exchanging regular soul sand for compressed soul sand, one can then engulf $(item)iron blocks$() into blocks of $(item)soul steel$().

By surrounding the soulfire with lapis, one can then engulf $(item)tinted glass$(); the process turns the glass blue. While serving as a pretty decoration block, this glass also has other uses. It should be noted that this process $(bold)does not$() destroy its focus structure.
By surrounding the soulfire with soul steel, one can then engulf a $(item)broken spawner$() to restore it - and more. This creation is better detailed in its own entry.

By surrounding the soulfire with quartz, one can then engulf $(item)soul powder$() into a crystalline form. So imbued, the crystal holds the property to absorb the souls of things one kills while it is carried - once.
By surrounding the soulfire with soul slate, one can then further refine the $(item)soul crystal shard$(). This has the effect of allowing it to contain 256 souls, rather than one.

By surrounding the soulfire with soul glass, one can even further refine the $(item)crude soul crystal$(). This seems to enhance its functions entirely, and in combination with the $(item)soul cage$(), is key to creating one's own spawner.

By surrounding the soulfire with a more elaborate structure I have named the pylon focus, one can engulf a $(item)soul cage$() to create a soul revitalizer. I have written about this miraculous device in another entry.
By utilizing the pylon focus, one can engulf $(item)soul glass$() to create a decorative pylon. I have written about pylons in another entry, and further pylon recipes shall not be discussed here.
